abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders addresses race-relations in South Carolina speech, courting essential black vote after criticism from activists; stump speeches still draw mostly whites and focus more on economics rather than racial justice; African-American campaign aide Symone Sanders is working to change dynamic.
lead_paragraph: As he campaigned in the state, Mr. Sanders, who has run into difficulty with the Black Lives Matter movement, tested his emphasis on issues like institutional racism.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Courts Black Voters in South Carolina After Criticism on Racial Issues
